alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:59PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Wharton, southern Fort Bend, northwestern Brazoria and northeastern Matagorda Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Boling-Iago, or 13 miles northwest of West Columbia. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, southeastern Rosenberg, Manvel, West Columbia, First Colony, Fresno, Needville, Arcola, Iowa Colony, Holiday Lakes, Pleak, Fairchilds, Bonney, Thompsons, New Territory, Sienna Plantation, Brazos Bend State Park and Greatwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
